metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46880 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A missing check related to tex units could have led to a use-after-free and potentially exploitable crash.
*Note*: This advisory was added on December 13th, 2022 after we better understood the impact of the issue. The fix was included in the original release of Firefox 105. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.6, Firefox < 105, and Thunderbird < 102.6. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46880` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
